content:
Ever wonder how you can make your PowerApp so that a user can press a button, use UI cues to show the user that something is happening, then make sure something happens first before you can press that button again in your app?

 

Now you can learn how to do this yourself, with our interactive App Timer Wait Recipe PowerApp Solution by Dynamics Edge which guides you step by step on how to do this with a fully working example included in the app!

 

You can use this as a starting example, and this type of pattern can apply to many use cases like waiting for a response from a Power Automate Flow before allowing further presses of a button or further interaction in a PowerApp, and any number of advanced use cases.

 

Download our solution by using the .msapp file attachment in this post called AppTimerWaitRecipeDynamicsEdge.msapp
